channel.title: Queries hanging and/or will not save
channel.description:
### Issue Summary
We recently migrated to self hosted redash and things generally work, but a) queries hang frequently, and b) attempts to save queries often fail. BigQuery is our only data source.
The inability to save queries is particularly frustrating because when it's successful it happens instantly, and when it fails it also does so instantly (and for all repeated attempts). Forking queries successfully creates a new copy but we're often not able to save after modifying.
At the guidance of redash support we've confirmed memory utilization is <50% and increased workers for ad hoc and scheduled queries, but the issues persist.
Any help is appreciated! Thanks in advance-
### Technical details:
* Redash Version: 10.0.0.b50363 * Browser/OS: chrome / mac * How did you install Redash: self hosted on GCP

item.title: Queries hanging and/or will not save
item.dc:creator: jesse
item.description:
Thanks for the ping. Recovering from a covid infection at the mo, so my responses are delayed.

There’s no enough information in your post to know what exactly what is wrong. It sounds like something is overloaded.

I recommend you examine your docker logs with docker-compose logs in your VM. Particularly you can try this while attempting a save operation.

You can also check the System Status (click your avatar on the navbar) to see if many jobs are running at once.

Read full topic
item.source: Queries hanging and/or will not save

item.title: Queries hanging and/or will not save

item.description:
hi @jesse – are you able to help here? thanks in advance-

item.description:
Issue Summary

We recently migrated to self hosted redash and things generally work, but a) queries hang frequently, and b) attempts to save queries often fail. BigQuery is our only data source.

The inability to save queries is particularly frustrating because when it’s successful it happens instantly, and when it fails it also does so instantly (and for all repeated attempts). Forking queries successfully creates a new copy but we’re often not able to save after modifying.

At the guidance of redash support we’ve confirmed memory utilization is <50% and increased workers for ad hoc and scheduled queries, but the issues persist.

Any help is appreciated! Thanks in advance-
